Class Cars

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cars
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Movable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Saab95, Volvo240

    public abstract class Cars
extends java.lang.Object
implements Movable
    An abstract class used for modelling a car's structure as well as its driving behaviours.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Arianit Zeqiri, Jakob Str√•hle, Veronica Segerlind

      Constructs a new car for the given parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cars

        public Cars(int nrDoors,
            double enginePower,
            double currentSpeed,
            java.awt.Color color,
            java.lang.String modelName,
            int direction,
            double xPosition,
            double yPosition)
        Constructs a new car for the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        nrDoors - an int representing the number of doors of the car
        enginePower - a double representing the engine power of the car
        currentSpeed - a double depicting the current speed of the car
        color - a Color object representing the color of the car
        modelName - a String containing the model name of the car
        direction - an int that keeps track of the direction of the car, in degrees. The car can point in four directions: 0 degrees (East), 90 degrees (North), 180 degrees (West) and 270 degrees (South).
        xPosition - a double that keeps track of the x position of the car
        yPosition - a double that keeps track of the y position of the car

      • move

        public void move()
        moves the object if the object's current speed is not 0. Where the object is moved is determined by the value of its direction and current speed.
        Specified by:
        move in interface Movable
